intro: Manisuris altissima, commonly known as the tall manisuris, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its tall, slender stem and clusters of small, daisy-like flowers that bloom in the summer months. The plant is native to certain regions of South America and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Manisuris altissima is often found in wetlands and along riverbanks, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
